event.title: was created by an act of the Tennessee General Assembly on November 6, 1801

data.event: Jackson County was created by an act of the Tennessee General Assembly on November 6, 1801.

event.title: was built 10 miles (16 km) west of Gainesboro on the Cumberland River, in what is now

data.event: In the 1790s, an Army outpost named Fort Blount was built 10 miles (16 km) west of Gainesboro on the Cumberland River, in what is now western Jackson County.

event.title: a disastrous courthouse fire on August 14, 1872

data.event: The county's early records were all lost in a disastrous courthouse fire on August 14, 1872.
